description: Dive into "Sun-Kissed Shores of Puerto Princesa" ‚Äî a handpicked list of places with quick notes, links, and essentials for fast trip planning and discovery.
title: Sun-Kissed Shores of Puerto Princesa

places.generalDescription: Puerto Princesa International Airport is the gateway to the natural wonders of Puerto Princesa, Palawan. This airport serves as a starting point for exploring attractions such as the underground river, Sabang Falls, Sabang Beach, and more. It has been recognized for its cleanliness and organization. While some travelers find taxi fares from the airport to be a bit pricey, others suggest opting for a tricycle as a more affordable alternative.

sources.shortName: Private Beach Trip in Puerto Princesa

places.name: Puerto Princesa International Airport

reviews.text:
A small but clean and spacious airport in Puerto Princesa, Palawan. The place is easy to navigate and has a nice, simple design. The staff members are also helpful.

Others:
‚úÖÔ∏è Restrooms
‚úÖÔ∏è Food stalls
‚úÖÔ∏è Water (you can bring an empty flask and fill it up inside the airport)

Puerto Princesa Airport is small but clean and well-organized. The terminal feels modern and bright, with large windows and a relaxed atmosphere that matches the vibe of Palawan. Check-in and security are generally smooth, though the waiting area can get crowded during peak hours.

Food and shopping options are limited, so it's better to eat before arriving. Transportation is easy-tricycles and vans are right outside, and the city center is just 15‚Äì20 minutes away.

Overall, it's a simple, stress-free airport that makes for a pleasant start or end to any trip in Palawan.

Puerto Princesa International Airport is one of the most convenient and welcoming gateways to Palawan. The terminal is modern, clean, and well-maintained, with a relaxed atmosphere that reflects the island's charm. The check-in and security processes are usually smooth and efficient, and staff members are generally friendly and accommodating.

The airport is not too large, which makes it easy to navigate-even first-time travelers won't have trouble finding their way around. Facilities are sufficient, with comfortable seating areas, restrooms that are kept tidy, and a few shops and food stalls offering snacks, coffee, and local souvenirs. The air conditioning inside provides a refreshing break from the tropical heat outside.

Its location is also a big advantage-just a short drive from the city proper, making transfers to hotels, restaurants, and attractions very convenient.

places.address: National Highway, Puerto Princesa City, Palawan, Philippines

places.generalDescription: Puerto Princesa City Baywalk Park is a serene and picturesque destination in Palawan, offering scenic walking areas and breathtaking bay views. The seaside promenade is lined with palm trees, making it perfect for walkers, bicyclists, and joggers. In addition to beach and island activities, visitors can take a city tour to explore the historical aspects of Puerto Princesa.

sources.snippet: Before you leave Puerto Princesa for your next trip, visit Baywalk for sunset watching. Here are some of my captures during my Puerto stay.
sources.shortName: East or West: Which Puerto Princesa beaches to visit?

places.name: Puerto Princesa City Baywalk Park

reviews.text: It's a place where people can do fitness activities like jogging, biking or walking. If you are a seafood lover, this place is recommendable for such. You can enjoy the and drinks while experiencing beautiful skies during sunset.

It's definitely a go-to place, especially at night. The view of the mountain range on the left side is scenic and relaxing. There are plenty of food carts and restaurants to choose from. You can find meals ranging from below ‚Ç±100 to over ‚Ç±400‚Äì‚Ç±500, depending on what you're looking for.

Puerto Princesa Baywalk is honestly one of the best public spots in the city if you're looking for a relaxing place to hang out. I love going there late in the afternoon, especially just before sunset. The sea breeze, the view of the water, and the warm colors of the sky make it a peaceful and beautiful spot to just slow down and breathe.

The walkway is wide and great for casual strolls or biking, and there are usually families, couples, and tourists around-everyone enjoying the same calm vibe. There are food stalls along the area too, selling grilled seafood, street food like fish balls, and cool drinks, which makes the experience even better.

What I appreciate is that the area feels safe and generally clean. But I do hope the city government continues to maintain it well-not just the pathway and landscaping, but also the facilities. One thing I noticed is the lack of clean, accessible restrooms. That would make a big difference for both locals and tourists. It would also be great if they could add more shaded areas or resting spots, especially for older visitors and families with kids. It gets really hot during the day, and a few more covered benches would go a long way.

Still, even with those improvements needed, the Baywalk is a gem in the city. It's not commercialized or overly crowded, and that's part of its charm. It gives you a real sense of the local life in Puerto Princesa-calm, simple, and close to nature.

places.address: Sandoval St, Puerto Princesa City, Palawan, Philippines

places.generalDescription: Talaudyong Beach is a picturesque and relatively uncrowded beach in Puerto Princesa, perfect for both adventure-seekers and those seeking relaxation. It's an ideal spot for swimming, exploring, and taking photos. The beach is also popular among surfers due to its big waves. Visitors can enjoy a delicious picnic lunch on the beach after a short boat ride.

sources.snippet: Talaudyong beach is tucked in the west side of the city that features a long stretch of white sand beach. This also a regular go-to place for locals like me because of its proximity to the city and serene vibes that makes one's visit very relaxing. This tour is designed for guests having an extra day or two in Puerto Princesa who are looking for a beach trip that does not involve boat rides - perfect for shore excursion guests!.
sources.shortName: Private Beach Trip in Puerto Princesa

sources.snippet: Situated in proximity to Nagtabon Beach, Talaudyong Beach is a beautiful sanctuary that‚Äôs rather out of the radar. Talaudyong Beach is one of the few beaches in Puerto Princesa that is seldom frequented by locals and tourists. Public transport is not available in the area but you can easily rent a motorbike to get to the beach yourself.
sources.shortName: Into Tropical Paradise: The Ten Best Beaches in Palawan

sources.snippet: Talaga namang mag-e-enjoy ka sa isa‚Äôt kalahating kilometro na haba ng shoreline nito, pinong buhangin, at magandang view (This beach‚Äôs 1.5-kilometer stretch of fine white sand and stunning scenery ensures that you‚Äôll have a great day),‚Äù Meneses said.
sources.shortName: Tourism office features Puerto Princesa's beautiful beaches in short video blog

sources.snippet: Talaudyong Beach is perfect for those who love the beach but hates the crowd. Unlike the most popular beaches in Palawan, it is seldom frequented by locals and tourists. The beach can also be reached with a motorbike.
sources.shortName: 10 Most Beautiful Beaches to Visit in Palawan

sources.snippet: If you‚Äôre renting a motorbike, drive for about 15 minutes to Talaudyong Beach. Much bigger and with literally no tourists (only a few locals) this is yet another hidden gem in Puerto Princesa.
sources.shortName: Nagtabon Beach - the best beach in Puerto Princesa, Palawan

places.name: Talaudyong Beach

reviews.text: Even¬†though¬†it's¬†quite¬†a¬†journey¬†from¬†the¬†city,¬†the¬†trip¬†is¬†worthwhile. It's¬†not¬†overly¬†crowded,¬†and¬†most¬†of¬†the¬†visitors¬†are¬†locals. Very¬†tranquil;¬†you¬†can¬†soak¬†up¬†the¬†sun¬†while¬†enjoying¬†the¬†beach. With¬†your¬†family¬†and¬†friends,¬†you¬†can¬†engage¬†in¬†a¬†variety¬†of¬†activities,¬†such¬†as¬†kayaking¬†and¬†volleyball. Shower¬†and¬†change¬†rooms¬†are¬†also¬†available. There¬†is¬†a¬†grilling¬†area,¬†so¬†you¬†are¬†welcome¬†to¬†bring¬†food¬†and¬†prepare¬†it¬†there. Large¬†parking¬†lot¬†and¬†helpful¬†personnel. Try¬†heading¬†here¬†if¬†you're¬†looking¬†for¬†a¬†swimming¬†beach¬†close¬†to¬†Puerto¬†Princesa.

Clean, quiet and beautiful beach.  Has an entrance fee of 100 pesos per person. If you want to use tables or tents - it could cist more.  About 1 hour drive from Puerto Princesa town.
There are souvenir seller walking around. No possibility to buy food or drinks. Toilet, changing rooms and a hose for cleaning your feet provided near by. Worth visiting.

This beach is just adjacent to batchawan beach. Can just walk by..

Lot of  camping options available and people often visit here for family related activities and hangouts.
Car parking space is also conveniently located.
Free entry to the beach.
Safe for small kids to play at the beach.

places.generalDescription: Luli Island, part of the picturesque Honda Bay in Puerto Princesa, is a unique sandbar that emerges during low tide and disappears underwater when the tide rises. This tiny islet offers visitors an exceptional experience of strolling on the sandbar surrounded by the crystal-clear turquoise waters of the bay. While island hopping around Honda Bay may not be as stunning as El Nido or Coron, it's still worth exploring if you're in Puerto Princesa.

sources.snippet: The island is famous for its sand bar and the very shallow water around it. Sometimes, it even gets lost under the waves, so it‚Äôs not mentioned on the map of the islands of Palawan.
sources.shortName: 16 Best Beaches in Palawan Philippines

places.name: Luli Island

reviews.text: Will definitely go back. The beach is so inviting. I have enjoyed swimming and snorkeling. There's a diving area as well. The kids would definitely enjoy it too. There are so many activities you can enjoy such as kayaking, snorkeling, and swimming.

It was part of the Honda Bay Island hopping tour. It's such a cute Island. At high tides, it's barely there. Getting a buko coconut there is a must. Drink it when bathing in the sea then carve out the coconut to eat it.

Luli Island is a unique stop in the Honda Bay island-hopping tour, known for its sandbar that ‚Äúsinks and rises‚Äù with the tide - hence the name Lulubog, Lilitaw. It's a cool natural feature and a fun photo spot, especially during low tide when the sandbar is fully visible.

The island is generally good for swimming, lounging, and quick stops, with shallow, calm waters and a few shaded areas to rest. There's also a small diving platform for those who want to jump into deeper water.

However, the place clearly needs better maintenance. During our visit, there was noticeable floating marine debris along the shore, which took away from the otherwise beautiful scenery. While this might depend on tides or weather, more regular cleanup would definitely improve the experience. With increasing tourist traffic, upkeep is important to preserve the island's appeal.

Snorkeling isn't ideal here, as there's not much marine life, and the island can feel crowded when multiple tour groups arrive at the same time. Facilities are basic, and there's not much to do beyond swimming and taking pictures.

Pros:
‚Ä¢	Unique sandbar that appears/disappears with the tide
‚Ä¢	Good for swimming and photos
‚Ä¢	Quick, convenient stop during Honda Bay tour

Cons:
‚Ä¢	Floating marine debris; area needs better upkeep
‚Ä¢	Crowded during peak hours
‚Ä¢	Limited activities and marine life

Overall:
Luli Island is an interesting and photogenic spot, but it would benefit greatly from more consistent maintenance and environmental care. A worthwhile part of the Honda Bay tour - just don't expect to spend too long here.

places.address: VQF8+FQW, Puerto Princesa City, Palawan, Philippines

places.generalDescription: Sabang Beach is a picturesque tropical paradise nestled amidst lush jungle surroundings, featuring palm trees and stunning mountain views. It serves as the gateway to the renowned Puerto Princesa Subterranean River, a UNESCO World Heritage Site and one of the New 7 Wonders of Nature. The beach extends along the coast, offering a tranquil and idyllic stretch perfect for relaxation and outdoor activities.

sources.snippet: Nestled along the coast of Palawan‚Äôs western shore, Sabang Beach is one of Palawan‚Äôs beloved and well-known beaches. For most travelers, it is known as the jump-off point to the renowned Underground River. However, the place is also known to be a quiet and relaxing escape for those seeking solitude.
sources.shortName: Into Tropical Paradise: The Ten Best Beaches in Palawan

sources.snippet: After the Puerto Princesa Subterranean River National Park experience, we headed back to Sabang Beach for lunch. We were so tired and hungry so when our buffet lunch was ready, we were more than ready to dig in. Unlimited Filipino food at Sabang‚Äôs gorgeous beach ‚Äî oh life, I love you.
sources.shortName: Sabang Beach: A Playful Day in Puerto Princesa, Palawan, Philippines

sources.snippet: Set along the dramatic, undeveloped coast of Palawan‚Äôs eastern shore, Sabang Beach is one of the island‚Äôs most famous beaches. It is known as the jump-off point to the Underground River. Despite its popularity, however, it‚Äôs still a quiet place to spend a few days relaxing.
sources.shortName: 10 Most Beautiful Beaches to Visit in Palawan

sources.snippet: The town is known for island hopping, water sports activities, and beautiful beaches like White Beach and Sabang Beach, and for its vibrant nightlife, making it an ideal choice for those who enjoy a more active social life.
sources.shortName: Battle of the Beaches: Palawan or Puerto Galera?

sources.snippet: It‚Äôs the first beach I came into contact with when I visited Palawan and fell in love. It‚Äôs a long and wide beach where both tourists and locals walk.
sources.shortName: 16 Best Beaches in Palawan Philippines

places.name: Sabang Beach

reviews.text: Great beach, completely unspoiled. There are few tourists and you can enjoy your personal time. But it takes 1.5 hours by car from the airport and is not easy to get there.

This is very beautiful sandy beach. Very easy swim there calm and silent. the beach is far away from  Puerto Prinsesa almost one and half hour. by car You can spend your time there, visit underground river and do zipline

Wow wow wow Sabang beach üèùÔ∏è

We have just returned to the UK following our 6 night stay. We visited the beach everyday and were very often the only people there less the locals walking to and from their boats.

The beach was clean, the water clear and so warm, like stepping into a warm bath!

There are so many fish and shallow too, my recommendation is to bring a snorkel ü§ø or snorkel mask with you so you don't miss out.

At the far right of the beach (furthest away from the harbour) you will find the corals and rock pools which are a fish haven. We were. So lucky to see so many varieties of fish and literally ankle deep, so perfect for little people to enjoy too.

Swimming felt safe as it was calm, but the resorts do put flags out so do check them out for warnings.

Do bring:
* bug spray as there's reports of sand fleas although we never experienced any bites ü¶ü
* sunscreen üß¥
* snorkelling equipment ü§ø
* towels if you aren't staying at a resort locally
* bottled drinking water üö∞
* water shoes if exploring the rocks as they are sharp, we did ok wearing flip flops ü©¥

places.generalDescription: Nagtabon Beach, located just a short boat ride away from Talaudyong, is a local hotspot known for its picturesque beauty and tranquility. It's a popular spot for surfers due to its big waves, making it perfect for adventure-seekers. However, it also offers a peaceful retreat for those seeking relaxation. The beach is ideal for people-watching and picnics, with the nearby Nagtabon Viewdeck offering stunning views of the cove and sunset.
places.name: Nagtabon Beach

reviews.text:
Great place for those whom likes calm beach with "wavy water". Sand reaches far into the sea, sparing need of aqua shoes (no reef, sharp stones, etc.).
Best to come here with a driver, who usialy stay 5h. For such trip from PPS we payed about 3500 pesos.

3 stars because beach was dirty with trash at stores and entrance and somewhat on beach. No fee to enter. Beautiful view, water clean and clear. Nice waves. Multiple Sari sari stores there beer food etc. Was not crowded. I will go back someday.

Best beach in pps in my opinion.
Nice waters, waves at times, lots of space and nice sand.
Beach was clean, there's a rocky area down the end which is fun.
There are stalls selling food and drink. I recommend the first stall on the right as you arrive at the beach.
Very nice lady, helpful and cooks delicious food.
I recommend getting the fish as all the fish is fresh straight out of the sea and is delicious.
You can see the fishermen come in with their catch's which is interesting.

places.generalDescription: Nestled in the heart of Puerto Princesa, Blue Palawan Beach Club is a hidden gem that offers an unexpected escape from the bustling city. As you step through its unassuming entrance, you're greeted by charming native-style huts and a serene private beach that beckons relaxation. The resort features an inviting infinity pool where guests can unwind while soaking up stunning views of the surrounding landscape. With its beach village design and delicious dining options, Blue Palawan provides a perfect blend of comfort and local flavor.

sources.snippet: Another top Puerto Princesa Beach resort is the Blue Palawan Beach Club. If you are looking for where to stay in Puerto Princesa near the beach,  this seaside property offers four kinds of accommodations which are all air-conditioned and feature the resort's custom memory foam mattresses to provide guests with a restful stay. Guests can also access free WiFi from the suites to keep connected with friends and family even while on vacation.
sources.shortName: 10 Best Puerto Princesa Palawan Hotels and Resorts: Beachfront, Islands, With Pool

sources.snippet: Blue Palawan- aside from being a beach front, this place has an infinity pool, native style architecture, beach village- designed huts and serves good food. Travel time: 15 minutes
sources.shortName: Featuring: The Nearest Beaches in Puerto Princesa City Proper

places.name: Blue Palawan Beach Club

reviews.text: Didn't stay here but had lunch at their restaurant, the staff are so lovely! Excellent customer service. My friend and I ordered the chicken kebab meal and bacon and cheese pizza, absolutely delicious; there's no other way to describe the quality of the food. For dessert we tried their peanut flavoured cake, forgot the name, it was mouth watering and probably the best cake I've had in a long time

Staff was very helpful and friendly. Food was very good. Nice pool. More rustic than I was expecting. Rooms need updated. A/C in room was lacking. It was cooler outside than inside most of the time. The lock on the door didn't seem very secure. Dogs barking in the wee hours of the morning distributing sleep.  Hard to get change. Could not swim in the water on the beach.

Disappointed on arrival. The beach is tidal and muddy. The rooms are needing an up grade and towels although clean and smell nice, a bit thin and grey. The breakfast was good and  they varied it each day. but the food in the evening wasn't so great and the wine ¬£20 a bottle, and poor quality.
Not enough shelf space for clothes if you are staying more than a few nights.
But its so relaxing,
Depite it's negatives we enjoyed our stay.

places.address: QQ9C+578, BM Road, Hidden Beach, Puerto Princesa City, 5300, Philippines

places.generalDescription: Honda Bay is a stunning destination that serves as a gateway to the natural wonders of Palawan. Known for its idyllic swimming and diving opportunities, this picturesque bay offers boat tours to charming nearby islands. While exploring Honda Bay, visitors can enjoy island-hopping adventures that include stops at Starfish Island, famous for its bamboo dining setups; Luli Island, with its unique shifting sandbar and snorkeling spots; and Cowrie Island, perfect for beach volleyball and seaside dining.

sources.snippet: If you‚Äôre visiting Puerto Princesa, you‚Äôve probably already planned to visit the Underground River or Honda Bay. However, if you are willing to be a bit adventurous and step off-the-beaten path, you‚Äôll find one of the most beautiful and unspoiled beaches in Palawan ‚Äì Nagtabon Beach.
sources.shortName: Nagtabon Beach - the best beach in Puerto Princesa, Palawan

places.name: Honda Bay

reviews.text:
Simple yet very relaxing islands. Each island has its own beauty and uniqueness to offer. Swimming, snorkelling, or simply sitting down are all worth the time.

I would advice to go here early in the morning to get a tour during peak seasons. A lot of tourists are in this place.

A good day out with the family, lots of fun activities for the kids and beaches for parents to relax on. Not the best islands in Palawan because of the higher volume on tourists but still beautiful, don't expect reefs or colourful corals.

Nice overall experience. Our tour guide Raquel was very knowledgeable, warm and attentive to all our needs. As well as our van driver and Kuya bangkeros especially Patrick who helped us everytime with our bags. Lunch at Starfish Island was yummy with mostly grilled options, fish, shrimps and liempo. There's a small market for some seafood which they can actually cook for you. We had fruits for dessert with their local yellow sweet watermelon and pineapple. Bring a lot of sunblock, wide brimmed hats and your own cold water if possible as the heat can really be a beast especially at noon time. Cellphone signal can be intermittent. Luli island was our first stop, it had a small sandbar strip as it was high tide then. There were also floating cottages where you can chill if you choose not to swim. Overall a great experience especially seeing the crystal blue waters plus the fine sand of Cowrie island, the most beautiful and biggest of the 3.

places.generalDescription: Cowrie Island is a popular stop on the Honda Bay island-hopping tour. It offers fine white sand, clear blue waters, and opportunities for beach activities and relaxation. Visitors can sip fresh coconut juice, take envy-worthy beach photos, swim, snorkel, and enjoy amenities such as a restaurant, bar, henna tattoo services, and massage options. However, guests should be cautious of jellyfish in the area.

sources.snippet: Although it‚Äôs a small island, there is a restaurant, umbrellas, sunbeds, toilets, and some of the most beautiful palm trees I have seen. Of course, with an incredible beach.
sources.shortName: 16 Best Beaches in Palawan Philippines

places.name: Cowrie Island

reviews.text:
During our cruise boat excursion, we had the chance to visit Cowrie Island, a tropical paradise near Puerto Princesa, Palawan. Known for its white sandy beaches, crystal-clear waters, and laid-back atmosphere, the island provided the perfect escape for relaxation and exploration.

As we arrived, we were greeted by swaying palm trees and inviting beachfront cabanas. The island's small size made it easy to explore, and we found plenty of shaded areas to unwind while enjoying the cool ocean breeze. The shoreline was stunning, with gentle waves lapping against the sand, making it ideal for wading and soaking up the sun.

While we chose to relax on the beach, other visitors from our group went snorkeling and reported that the coral viewing was excellent. They described colorful reefs teeming with marine life, making it a great spot for those interested in underwater exploration. For non-snorkelers like us, the island still offered plenty to enjoy, including beachside dining with fresh seafood and refreshing coconut drinks.

The island had a relaxed, uncrowded feel, making it a perfect getaway from the busy mainland. Whether you want to snorkel, swim, or simply unwind on a beautiful beach, Cowrie Island is a fantastic destination. I highly recommend visiting for a peaceful and scenic retreat. Even without snorkeling, the stunning views, warm waters, and tranquil vibe made this a memorable stop on our cruise excursion.

Cowrie Island is a beautiful and well-maintained destination. The island is clean, and the food provided was excellent, making the experience even more enjoyable. The waters are crystal clear, perfect for swimming and relaxing.

However, one thing that should be improved is visitor awareness of marine life. There are plenty of starfishes around the island, but unfortunately, we saw guests lifting and throwing them, which was really sad. It would be great to have signage reminding visitors not to touch or disturb marine animals to help protect them and preserve the island's ecosystem.

Overall, our stay was wonderful, and with a little more focus on conservation efforts, it could be even better for both guests and marine life.

Cowrie Island is usually the final and most relaxing stop on the Honda Bay island-hopping tour - and for good reason. Among the islands in the area, it's the most developed, with decent facilities like cottages, restrooms, dining areas, and massage huts, making it ideal for resting and enjoying a lazy afternoon by the beach.

The shoreline is wide and clean, with plenty of space to swim, lounge, or just hang out under a nipa hut. There are food and drink options on-site, and you can buy snacks, grilled meals, or drinks (some tour packages already include lunch here). There are also areas for volleyball and even some water activities depending on the season.

While it's great for groups and families, it's not perfect:
‚Ä¢	The water is calm but not very clear, especially if there are a lot of boats and swimmers.
‚Ä¢	It can get crowded, especially during peak tourist hours or weekends.
‚Ä¢	Marine life here is minimal, so don't expect good snorkeling - it's more for relaxing than exploring underwater.

Still, the overall vibe is laid-back, and the convenience of having restrooms, food, and shade makes Cowrie Island a comfortable stop for travelers looking to unwind.

Pros:
‚Ä¢	Best facilities among Honda Bay islands
‚Ä¢	Spacious, clean beach area
‚Ä¢	Food, drinks, and shaded huts available
‚Ä¢	Great for families and groups

Cons:
‚Ä¢	Not ideal for snorkeling
‚Ä¢	Can be crowded during peak hours
‚Ä¢	Water is not as clear compared to less-developed islands

Overall:
Cowrie Island is a solid, relaxing stop on the Honda Bay tour. It may not offer the most pristine waters, but its comfort and convenience make it a good place to end your island-hopping day on a chill note.

places.address: RQQ9+W7J, Ramesamay Island, Puerto Princesa City, Palawan, Philippines

sources.snippet: I hope that you‚Äôve found helpful my guide about Nagtabon Beach. This is definitely one of the most beautiful beaches in Palawan and you shouldn‚Äôt miss it if you‚Äôre visiting Puerto Princesa. Let me know if you have any questions in the comments section below.
sources.shortName: Nagtabon Beach - the best beach in Puerto Princesa, Palawan

places.name: Villa Nagtabon

reviews.text: Very Quiet place, near the beach, hosts are very nice and they greet you on your arrival. They do housekeeping every day too! They also have two friendly dogs which is a plus üòç

Evthe owners are very welcoming , Tony and Lisa are perfect host. We stayed here for two nights. The bangalow is clean, they even prepared a surprise for our honeymoon celebration. The minus is that the beach is 15 min walk in the sun. Tony can pick you up and drive you but only two time a day, when you want to chill is quite hard to know when you want to go home or have a dinner or breakfast, but for us there was no problem , there are trycicles on the beach. Some osom people always on the beach just interact ;))) one more minus is that from 6 in the morning you can hear a lot of motorbikes going to the beach and back ;) but it's cozy and wild experience, depend of what you are looking ;))
The place has an amazing panoramic view of the mountains!‚ù§üëå

places.address: WMM3+XRV, Nagtabon Beach, Barangay Bacungan, Palawan, Puerto Princesa City, 5300, Philippines

places.generalDescription: BM Beach is a long stretch of coastline located near the city center of Puerto Princesa. While it may not be the most pristine beach in the area, its convenient location makes it a popular choice for those looking to escape the hustle and bustle of the city. Visitors can access the beach for free and there are several resorts along the shoreline offering amenities such as cottage rentals and karaoke machines.

sources.snippet: Presented by City Tourism Office (CTO) senior operations officer and chief of promotions marketing Michie Hitosis-Meneses, the 3:59 video blog takes viewers to BM Beach, Hartman Beach, Pristine Beach, and the new community-based tourism site (CBST) Canigaran Beach, which are all located in Puerto Princesa‚Äôs urban barangays.
sources.shortName: Tourism office features Puerto Princesa's beautiful beaches in short video blog

sources.snippet: BM Beach‚Äì Also facing the east coast, has very shallow water stretching for about a kilometer. Like all the near east coast beaches, has water not so ideal for swimming. Travel time: 15 minutes and one has to pay 20 pesos entrance fee
sources.shortName: Featuring: The Nearest Beaches in Puerto Princesa City Proper

places.name: BM Beach

reviews.text: Check out BM. Good for families as the water is shallow. Everyone that manages the place is great. Grill available for BBQ, bathrooms, and day huts for rent. Don't be surprised if a family is having karaoke party or a birthday fiesta!

the shore is completely covered with algae. To swim you need to cross the water far from the shore for about a hundred meters or more. there are cafes and taxis that can take you somewhere. It seems there is no service that cleans the beach, in some places you can see a lot of garbage

A long stretch of beach near the city proper. It's not the best and cleanest beach in Puerto Princesa, but it's very accessible and it can pass as a good escape from the city. Entrance to the beach is free, but There are several resorts along the beach, where you can rent a cottage and even karaoke machines. Best to bring your own food and drinks, but we saw several vendors selling light snacks (peanuts, ice cream, and shell fish).

places.generalDescription: Hartman Beach is a serene and beautiful destination, known for its crystal clear waters and peaceful atmosphere. Visitors can enjoy the unique sight of Moana and Maui along the way, making it an ideal place to unwind and appreciate the natural beauty of the sandbar. Overall, it's a great spot for those seeking tranquility by the water.

sources.snippet: Presented by City Tourism Office (CTO) senior operations officer and chief of promotions marketing Michie Hitosis-Meneses, the 3:59 video blog takes viewers to BM Beach, Hartman Beach, Pristine Beach, and the new community-based tourism site (CBST) Canigaran Beach, which are all located in Puerto Princesa‚Äôs urban barangays.
sources.shortName: Tourism office features Puerto Princesa's beautiful beaches in short video blog

places.name: Hartman Beach

reviews.text: The beach is nice if it is high tide

You will pass by a residential area before reaching the beach.  It's not properly maintained and looks like a public beach where anyone can go and chill.  But I don't suggest you go swim on the beach because I don't think it's clean enough considering there are nearly residential homes. But you may rent a boat and go to the nearest sandbar.  They have double decker boats that ranges from 1,500 to 2,000 per day.  They also have smaller ones for 1,000.00.  I just stayed there for fresh air but the area looks abandoned and needs to be developed.  It can be found at the far end of Wescom road.  You'll never thought there is a place like that in the City unless you are from that area.
Don't expect white and clean beach. Local beach for sunrise and good strong wind.

places.generalDescription: Tagkawayan Beach, along with Napsan Beach, Talaudyong Beach, and Simpocan Beach, is a nearby destination for those seeking thrilling beach adventures. Besides indulging in various beach activities like body surfing and boogie boarding due to the presence of enjoyable waves, visitors can also explore the area's natural wonders such as Tagkurring Waterfalls and Salakot Waterfalls.

sources.shortName: Tourism office features Puerto Princesa's beautiful beaches in short video blog

places.name: Tagkawayan Beach

reviews.text:
Beautiful beach. Not many people during the week. Weekends busier but not too busy as it's such a large beach.
River water from the mountains flow down into the sea so you get freezing cold fresh water and warm sea water at the same time where the river water meets the sea.
A few vendors here to get food, drink etc.
BBQ areas and benches here also.

Free access to the beach c/o Puerto Princesa City. Watch out for big waves during the rainy season.  Cottage/tables managed by the local community. No cooked food for sale, only chips and drinks from the sari-sari/convenience store. Bring your own food! Had a good time here :)

A rich place to have a nice view of the seaside
At the location, the place is mostly sandy with rocky terrain, 36 Kilometers or 22 Miles, an Hour from the city.

There is a trail which is the main road to where you can navigate through the other side of the beach by foot or by vehicle

The view and the scenery is great and it's great for having a breakfast here. Windy and a foggy distance. The waves are pretty huge and scary and the locals don't recommend going too far into the water.
There are some locals that teach surfing and swimming lessons which is great the fact that the waves in this beach are huge.

Overall it's a nice place to relax and enjoy the calm beach. 7/10

places.generalDescription: Chez Rose Beach Bar is a renowned entertainment hub in Puerto Princesa, offering live bands, dancers, and fire dancers for a lively atmosphere. The bar on the second floor provides great food and a decent selection of wines. For those seeking a more private setting, there's seating away from the main stage with attentive service. Owner Rose Dante is known for her hospitality.

sources.shortName: Featuring: The Nearest Beaches in Puerto Princesa City Proper

places.name: Chez Rose Beach Bar

reviews.text:
The best parties in Puerto Princesa happen here! Facing the east side you can watch the moonrise and greet the sunrise after a great night of dancing.

The only beachfront venue with great music (guest djs from all over the globe) , friendly people, nice bar menu.

We had a great time exploring the beach and relaxing while the sun set üòÄ‚úåÔ∏è there's even kite surfing available! They support local bands, have wonderful food and host some of the best festivals in Palawan! Highly recommended ‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê

Chez Rose is now an iconic bar in Puerto Princesa, a total entertainment center with the newly added bar on its second floor. Great entertainment can be had here, from live bands, dancers and even fire dancers, Food is great and so is the bar. they even have a decent selection of wines. There is a more private seating aft from the more raucous stage and you will enjoy the service and attention its staff gives. Owner Rose Dante  is one of the more hospitable person in Puerto Princesa! Come and enjoy a night of safe clean fun here!

places.address: 43 B.M. Rd, Puerto Princesa City, 5300 Palawan, Philippines
